channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal resignation deadline looms. And, the implications of a USAID shutdown
item.description: It's decision day for millions of federal employees who find themselves at a "fork in the road." And, the Trump administration's plans to shut down USAID could have devastating consequences worldwide.
item.content:encoded:
It's decision day for millions of federal employees who find themselves at a "fork in the road." And, the Trump administration's plans to shut down USAID could have devastating consequences worldwide.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Israel defense minister tells army to prepare to relocate Palestinians from Gaza
item.description: He says the military should prepare exit options by land, sea and air so that anyone who wishes to can leave for "any country willing to accept them."
item.content:encoded:
He says the military should prepare exit options by land, sea and air so that anyone who wishes to can leave for "any country willing to accept them."

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Jerome Socolovsky

item.title: Here's who will perform at the Super Bowl on Sunday
item.description: Kendrick Lamar is headlining the halftime show with special guest SZA. Jon Batiste will sing the national anthem.
item.content:encoded:
Kendrick Lamar is headlining the halftime show with special guest SZA. Jon Batiste will sing the national anthem.

(Image credit: Presley Ann/Getty Images for Spotify; Monica Schipper/Getty Images for The Recording Academy; Kevin Winter/Getty Images for The Recording Academy)
item.dc:creator: Dhanika Pineda

item.title: FBI agents, prosecutors fear retribution from Jan. 6 rioters pardoned by Trump
item.description: Officials involved in Jan. 6 prosecutions say the Trump administration isn't protecting them from threats. "We don't think they'll care — unless and until one of us gets killed," an official told NPR.
item.content:encoded:
Officials involved in Jan. 6 prosecutions say the Trump administration isn't protecting them from threats. "We don't think they'll care — unless and until one of us gets killed," an official told NPR.

(Image credit: Susan Walsh)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Even now, Ke Huy Quan doesn't feel good enough — but that narrative is changing
item.description: The Everything, Everywhere, All at Once star says the day after he won his Oscar for the role, he woke up thinking, "Was that all a dream?"
item.content:encoded:
The Everything, Everywhere, All at Once star says the day after he won his Oscar for the role, he woke up thinking, "Was that all a dream?"

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Don't give a hoot about sports? The Superb Owl might be for you
item.description: What began as an accidental misspelling or an online joke has soared into a cultural phenomenon.
item.content:encoded:
What began as an accidental misspelling or an online joke has soared into a cultural phenomenon.

(Image credit: Bruce Bennett)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: You have more control over your emotions than you think
item.description: In his new book, Shift, psychologist and neuroscientist Ethan Kross busts common assumptions about how to manage big feelings and explains why it's OK sometimes to avoid them for a while.
item.content:encoded:
Shift: Managing Your Emotions — So They Don't Manage You.'/>

In his new book, Shift, psychologist and neuroscientist Ethan Kross busts common assumptions about how to manage big feelings and explains why it's OK sometimes to avoid them for a while.

(Image credit: woocat/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Why CBS stands at the epicenter of Trump's assault on the media
item.description: CBS News appears likely to settle a lawsuit filed by President Trump in a case that legal observers say it should win. The network is caught up in Trump's assault on the media and an owner intent on finalizing a sale.
item.content:encoded:
CBS News appears likely to settle a lawsuit filed by President Trump in a case that legal observers say it should win. The network is caught up in Trump's assault on the media and an owner intent on finalizing a sale.

(Image credit: SOPA Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: As 'Fork' resignation deadline arrives, a federal judge will consider a stay
item.description: The Trump administration has given more than 2 million federal employees until Thursday to decide whether to stay or go. A last-minute court hearing may throw a wrench into the administration's plans.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has given more than 2 million federal employees until Thursday to decide whether to stay or go. A last-minute court hearing may throw a wrench into the administration's plans.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Baltic nations count final hours to ending electricity ties to Russia
item.description: The severing of electricity ties to Russia is rich in geopolitical significance. Work on it sped up after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
The severing of electricity ties to Russia is rich in geopolitical significance. Work on it sped up after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

(Image credit: Mindaugas Kulbis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
